title: Ghosts and The Dead
body:
Another small gift for @ceruleanstark

Arya Stark had been home for days now, or had it been weeks? Even here in the safety of the Winterland of her birth time was still escaping her. She aided Sansa in managing the people of the north. Sansa handled food, rations, workloads, and general instructions of how to prepare for what is coming. Arya spoke with the soldiers and the guards. She personally trained anyone who walks through the gate without ever having held a weapon before. A fact the Master of arms was growing more and more tiresome with. They were all supposed to be his students after all. His and the General of the Vale’s army. What his name was, slips Arya’s mind, but the man seemed completely loyal to her cousin. Even if he wasn’t as on board with this stand, they were attempting to make.

Her favorite student was the only Lyanna Mormont. Named the same as the aunt Arya never got to meet. The one every adult who met Lyanna Stark saw inside Arya. If Lyanna Stark was a fighter then she couldn’t have had anything on Arya’s favorite student. She was quick to learn a lesson after her first slip of the hand. She met every strike of Arya’s with the same steel in her eyes that Arya knew others saw in her.

One day Lyanna Mormont actually managed to land a hit o Arya. Something even the powerful Brienne had yet to do. The youngest ruler was better at the brute fighting style of Westeros, but she understood that when you go up to someone more powerful you have to dance around and tire them out. Although she rarely dodged she always matches her partners blow for blow. Repeatedly blocking their attacks with her sword was the way she wore them down. Not moving her sword much she always managed to get it in place at the right moment and save her energy doing so.

Arya was proud of the young ruler. If she survives the in-coming war then her people would be led well in the age that comes after. Even Sansa had to admit she was impressed by the Mormont. After hearing that on the island everyone was always training in preparation in case the Greyjoys ever attacked again only made it clearer that she was a born warrior.

“Arya Stark, as I live and breathe,” Comes a call from under her. Arya peers down from the tree where she was now watching training sessions. Below was a man, tall, with long dark hair. His face was covered in scruff, and his hair was shaggy. For a moment Arya believes she is looking down at Jory again. But the man under the tree was too short to be Jory. Arya says nothing as her surprise subsides. She waits for him to say something more.

“My name is Ryon Forrester! Of house Forrester,” He explains cupping his hands around his mouth. From the way, he spoke he clearly wasn’t that old. Looking closer now, he wouldn’t even have been Rickon’s age. A year or two behind probably. Young to be growing any sort of hair. “I’ve come to join the fight!” He adds twisting around to show a sword hanging off his waist. It was barely staying in place from the simple movement. This boy was greener than some of the southerners who had made their way up here.

“You should go find the Master of Swords!” She calls back down, looking back towards the eastern sky. Thinking of her family in these moments before the next battle. It was one of the few times she could.

“I want you to train me. Everyone says you are the best here! Even the youngest Mormont sings your praise. I’m only a year younger than her. I can swing a sword too, please teach me?” He pleads.

Arya’s only thought was of the last time she saw Rickon’s shaggy hair. He was two years younger then Rickon. A boy like that so eager to fight, with the look of a true Northman. He wouldn’t survive this battle. She sends him away with the excuse that she had to give her lady sister extra lessons. Jumping down she easily lands on her feet. Telling the young noble to go find the Master of arms before she runs back to the castle. Passing a woman with dark hair, and scars decorating her face as Arya left the Godswood.

She stops for a moment to watch the woman. If she was with that boy, then perhaps he would survive. Deep down a feeling in her stomach tells her that he would only join the other ghosts that haunt this castle. Walking now, Arya dips her head. Putting all trust into her feet to know the way without her eyes. For the grey steel orbs were gone. Just like they had been with the faceless men. Only now clouds of memories cover them over instead of the cloudy grey and black nothingness that had then.

It was her sister who found her. Instead of running to their parents’ old bedroom, Sansa had gone looking in the crypts. Finding her younger sister sitting still as a cat on Rickon’s crypt. Arya heard her sister but did not move to look at her. She expected to hear a lecture. One where Sansa would use up all her long words just to say how it is wrong to sit on the dead. A lot of good those lectures had done her littlest brother.

Rickon was told so many times to stay away from the crypts. Now he was resting within them. Right below her feet was his heart. Of that, she had no doubt. Sansa made only the occasional comment of their little brother. How little he was compared to the coffin father had prepared for a grown man. His crypt was the last one in the little line of theirs. It was his heart that rested directly under her feet.

Sansa did not lecture her sister. She also did not join her on the crypt. Having far too much respect for the dead to ever consider resting on them. Arya didn’t have that same sense of respect. She spent her first night back here resting the little bit she had on the cold feet of her father’s statue. Somehow she still fit. Despite all the growing she had done.

Sansa rested a soft hand against Arya’s head. Her slim fingers found their way through the brown hair their father had given her. Slowly as their mother once had, she moves her fingers back and forth across Arya’s skull. It gave her little comfort and more memories than seeing the boy who looked like Jory had.

“It’s okay to cry. I miss them too.” Sansa’s words were hollow. She was controlling herself. Keeping all of the information that should have been behind those words, locked up.

“I’m not crying. Just tired,” Arya huffs. Smacking her sister’s hand away lightly she finally looks up.

“Who knew assassins slept?” Sansa says jokingly. A smug smile on her face.

“Everyone sleeps. That is one of the best time to kill a man,” Arya smiles threateningly in return.

“Another is in the bed of men, I imagine,” Sansa’s smile was gone now. Squeezing her lips back into a tight line. She closes her blue eyes. Even in this darkness, you could see the blue of her eyes. I darkness no one could see Arya. Not her brown hair, her small form, or her grey eyes. She could vanish, but Sansa was born to hold everyone’s attention.

“I miss them too,” Sansa says, leaving their other conversation behind. Her sister looks sadly down at the crypt. “When this war is over. We’ll get him a statue. Like father’s.”

“We may all be dead by the time this war is over.” Arya points out. The hole in her heart wouldn’t let her even consider otherwise.

“Not all of us.” Sansa reaffirms, for once smiling like she use to with Jeyne as kids. The same smile she reserved for when she earned praise or was proud of her company. Arya missed that smile.

“You’ll have to commissioned the statue. I didn’t get to see him before he died.”

“Jon and I will make sure it looks like him. Better then father’s.” Lady Stark promises.

“Thank you,”

“Will you join me for dinner?”

Arya looks back down the dark tunnel. The only flame from the candles at the entrance. She could go back up, but something still asked her to stay. A deep feeling asking her to stay there with them. She may never see these crypts again.

“I’ll be up in a little bit.” Arya promises.

Down in the tunnels underground she felt them. The ones who will never leave home again. Rickon now with them.

Putting all trust into her feet to know the way without her eyes. For the grey steel orbs were gone. Just like they had been with the faceless men. Only now clouds of memories cover them over instead of the cloudy grey and black nothingness that had then.

It was her sister who found her. Instead of running to their parents’ old bedroom, Sansa had gone looking in the crypts. Finding her younger sister sitting still as a cat on Rickon’s crypt. Arya heard her sister but did not move to look at her. She expected to hear a lecture. One where Sansa would use up all her long words just to say how it is wrong to sit on the dead. A lot of good those lectures had done her littlest brother.

Rickon was told so many times to stay away from the crypts. Now he was resting within them. Right below her feet was his heart. Of that, she had no doubt. Sansa made only the occasional comment of their little brother. How little he was compared to the coffin father had prepared for a grown man. His crypt was the last one in the little line of theirs. It was his heart that rested directly under her feet.

Sansa did not lecture her sister. She also did not join her on the crypt. Having far too much respect for the dead to ever consider resting on them. Arya didn’t have that same sense of respect. She spent her first night back here resting the little bit she had on the cold feet of her father’s statue. Somehow she still fit. Despite all the growing she had done.

Sansa rested a soft hand against Arya’s head. Her slim fingers found their way through the brown hair their father had given her. Slowly as their mother once had, she moves her fingers back and forth across Arya’s skull. It gave her little comfort and more memories than seeing the boy who looked like Jory had.

“It’s okay to cry. I miss them too.” Sansa’s words were hollow. She was controlling herself. Keeping all of the information that should have been behind those words, locked up.

“I’m not crying. Just tired,” Arya huffs. Smacking her sister’s hand away lightly she finally looks up.

“Who knew assassins slept?” Sansa says jokingly. A smug smile on her face.

“Everyone sleeps. That is one of the best time to kill a man,” Arya smiles threateningly in return.

“Another is in the bed of men, I imagine,” Sansa’s smile was gone now. Squeezing her lips back into a tight line. She closes her blue eyes. Even in this darkness, you could see the blue of her eyes. I darkness no one could see Arya. Not her brown hair, her small form, or her grey eyes. She could vanish, but Sansa was born to hold everyone’s attention.

“I miss them too,” Sansa says, leaving their other conversation behind. Her sister looks sadly down at the crypt. “When this war is over. We’ll get him a statue. Like father’s.”

“We may all be dead by the time this war is over.” Arya points out. The hole in her heart wouldn’t let her even consider otherwise.

“Not all of us.” Sansa reaffirms, for once smiling like she use to with Jeyne as kids. The same smile she reserved for when she earned praise or was proud of her company. Arya missed that smile.

“You’ll have to commissioned the statue. I didn’t get to see him before he died.”

“Jon and I will make sure it looks like him. Better then father’s.” Lady Stark promises.

“Thank you,”

“Will you join me for dinner?”

Arya looks back down the dark tunnel. The only flame from the candles at the entrance. She could go back up, but something still asked her to stay. A deep feeling asking her to stay there with them. She may never see these crypts again.

“I’ll be up in a little bit.” Arya promises.

Down in the tunnels underground she felt them. The ones who will never leave home again. Rickon now with them.

summary: George RR Martin’s last “Game of Thrones” Script had “Arya Stark” as the Key to the North.“Martin has Roose Bolton tell his...
caption:
George RR Martin’s last “Game of Thrones” Script had “Arya Stark” as the Key to the North.

“Martin has Roose Bolton tell his bastard son: “We have a much better match in mind for you. A match to help House Bolton hold the north. Arya Stark.” - George RR Martin

&D said Sansa’s plot wasn’t that interesting for TV. So they gave her Jeyne’s Poole’s arc to be raped and brutalised. A mess.

After that GRRM decided to stop writing show scripts. 👀 But George looked very happy at this year’s Emmy red carpet and gleeful mentioned that plot points he wrote over 20 years ago will be in S8. D&D both said: the last season of GoT will swing back to George’s original book endgame. At Brazil Comic Con on Thursday, D&D answered Maisie’s question about when they knew how everything would end? They said they were already outlining Season 8 while they were producing Season 3! Holy shit. D&D’s decision to give Sansa more to do (i.e. jeyne poole storyline) was made during S2 BEFORE they knew how everything would end.

In the scripts George RR Martin wrote, he mentioned wanting GoT to go on for 12 or 13 seasons. And with more direwolf scenes!
ohmydays.

More from Vanity Fair: The GoT scripts have been archived by HBO in the Writers Guild of America Library in LA.
https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2018/12/game-of-thrones-george-rr-martin-last-script-the-lion-and-the-rose
All the drama this will cause the fandom. Why Vanity Fair?

summary: When I see a '' I love both Stark sisters equally '' post I raise an eyebrow because usually it is followed by such...
body:
When I see a “ I love both Stark sisters equally ” post I raise an eyebrow because usually it is followed by such comments:

“ Arya is Sansa’s sword ”
“ Arya was never bullied by her sister”
“ Arya was the one at fault in the Stark bowl in s7” (despite canon leaks claiming otherwise)

YOU DON’T LOVE BOTH SISTERS EQUALLY IF YOU CONSTANTLY THROW ARYA UNDER THE BUS JUST TO PROP UP SANSA.

Just admit you only love the older Stark sister and go on with your life. At least you will be honest.

summary: people say sansa's grown a lot in the series but she still hasn't really improved when it comes to her relationship with arya....
question: people say sansa's grown a lot in the series but she still hasn't really improved when it comes to her relationship with arya. why do you think that is (genuine question)?
answer:
Sansa has grown throughout the series, and very significantly. The reason she hasn’t had much development in her relationship with Arya is because she hasn’t been brought face to face with just how problematic that relationship was.

Sansa bullied Arya, but I highly doubt she understood it was bullying. Sansa partaking in (or at the very least not putting a stop to) calling Arya “Horseface” isn’t something she saw as harmful, though we the readers know it had lasting effects on Arya’s self esteem. The same goes for all the other times she treated Arya as inferior for having less than feminine traits. Nothing has happened yet to force Sansa into making that connection.

But we know it will, because Sansa’s treatment of Arya is a (much) smaller scale version of what Cersei does to Sansa. 

“You’re prettier with your mouth closed, Sansa,” Cersei told her. (Sansa III, ASOS)

“Joffrey and his mother say I’m stupid.” (Sansa IV, ACOK)

“Everyone wants to be loved.”

“I see flowering hasn’t made you any brighter,” said Cersei. “Sansa, permit me to share a bit of womanly wisdom with you on this very special day. Love is poison. A sweet poison, yes, but it will kill you all the same.” (Sansa IV, ACOK)

Cersei makes jabs at Sansa’s appearance, she insults her intelligence, and in the last quote she mocks her idealism. Her bullying is manipulative and intentional, and beyond that it’s spiteful. Cersei is a grown woman, and a queen besides; she knows exactly what kind of effect her words have, and she says them anyway.

The thing is, Cersei’s cruelty gives Sansa something to link her own flaws to. Sansa will be able to understand the humiliation Arya felt because she’s felt it too; she’s learned from Cersei what it feels like to be treated as lesser, and unlike Cersei, she’ll be able to grow past it. The dots are all in place, they just need to be connected.

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: So, speaking of George R. R. Martin’s original notes to his publisher, I have to say the first moment I began to suspect not...
caption:
So, speaking of George R. R. Martin’s original notes to his publisher, I have to say the first moment I began to suspect not only that the notes were not only still relevant in many ways, but that the tv series would likely get as close as it possibly could to whatever ending Martin was working towards, and that the show would move all the characters into place to get to that ending, was this recapt trailer that HBO posted before Season 7 started, back in 2017.

For me, this trailer pretty much confirmed the “five core characters” Martin mentioned in his notes as still being the core five characters for the story. Because at certain points in the trailer, each of those five characters are specifically highlighted, signaling the five of them out among all the other characters who are in the trailer, as if saying “Hey! Make sure you pay specific attention to these people!”  

Tyrion: 1:10

Daenerys: 1:45  

Jon: 2:40

Bran: 3:38

Arya: 4:03

And now, recently, we’ve just had the #ForTheThrone stills and promos a few weeks ago. And, once again, all five of these characters each specifically got one. In fact, the only other characters to get one of these promos, who are still alive, are Cersei and the Night King (as much as you can call a White Walker “alive” at any rate). And those two are clearly the two final antagonists. 

So while I think many things in those publisher notes got changed or moved or altered completely, I still think it hold a lot of still-relevant information as well. Maybe even more than anyone suspects.

Jon: 2:40

Bran: 3:38

Arya: 4:03

And now, recently, we’ve just had the #ForTheThrone stills and promos a few weeks ago. And, once again, all five of these characters each specifically got one. In fact, the only other characters to get one of these promos, who are still alive, are Cersei and the Night King (as much as you can call a White Walker “alive” at any rate). And those two are clearly the two final antagonists. 

So while I think many things in those publisher notes got changed or moved or altered completely, I still think it hold a lot of still-relevant information as well. Maybe even more than anyone suspects.

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary:
“Martin has Roose Bolton tell his bastard son: “We have a
 much better match in mind for you. A match to help House Bolton hold...
body:
“Martin has Roose Bolton tell his bastard son: “We have a much better match in mind for you. A match to help House Bolton hold the north. Arya Stark.” - George RR Martin for the season 4 episode script, The Lion and the Rose.

For all the folks going on and on about Sansa being the Key to the North etc. etc.? When GRRM wrote for the show, he still intended for Arya Stark to be the Key to the North.

Once again, Replacing Jeyne with Sansa was D&D’s plan to give Sophie Turner something  more to do and for Sansa to have a more important role on the show. That’s why they cannot do much with Sansa in the North.

For example, the Boltons call Sansa ‘The Key to the North’ and yet everything that happens on the show, does not support this statement at all. Just look at the difference between fArya in the North in the books, and Sansa on the show.

On the show, Jon hears nothing at all about Sansa till she reaches the wall and the pink letter is about Rickon

On the show Sansa runs away, and the Northern houses still support Ramsay without her. Meaning they are for house Bolton and not Stark.

Sansa asks for support from the Northern houses against Ramsay and no one gives it to her - no one wants to support the so called key to the North. They support Jon though.

It’s LF who gets the Vale army to ride North after threatening to have Yohn Royce thrown out the Moon Door and who later convinces Glover and Royce to support Sansa instead of Jon. Sansa herself does not engender their support.

After the BOTB won by the Vale, the North still chooses Ned’s bastard rather than the so called Key to the North.

The reason for this is that in the books, Sansa is disinherited from Winterfell since she is still married to Tyrion and as long as that marriage stands she cannot be Lady of WF or QITN. So the show cannot do any of that for Sansa even if they replace fArya with her and try to write a ‘Key to the North’ story for her.

Look at the vast difference between what they wrote for Sansa on the show and what GRRM wrote for the actual Key to the North in the books…

Winter is almost upon us, boy. And winter is death. I would sooner my men die fighting for the Ned’s little girl than alone and hungry in the snow, weeping tears that freeze upon their cheeks. No one sings songs of men who die like that. As for me, I am old. This will be my last winter. Let me bathe in Bolton blood before I die. I want to feel it spatter across my face when my axe bites deep into a Bolton skull. I want to lick it off my lips and die with the taste of it on my tongue.

That was said by Big Bucket Wull as the mountain clans march through the harshest winter to go save Arya from Ramsay.

We also have houses Mormont and Glover joining in with Stannis in his march to WF to defeat the Boltons. Rodrik Cassel’s men are also marching in his army, as are several northmen and former soldiers.

There’s also reason to believe that many of the Northerners who are supposedly supporting Roose are in fact plotting against him and are pissed at what his son is doing to fArya. That’s right - the lords are enraged at fArya’s treatment by Ramsay.

And then finally we have Jon - who agonizes over an entire book as to how to save Arya. He sends Mance and plots with Stannis and finally decides to go save her himself with an army of Wildlings and gets assassinated for it. His last dying thought is of Arya - stick them with the pointy end.

When he is brought back to life, he will be all the more eager to go kick Ramsay’s ass and save his little sister.

And finally remember, GRRM wanted to do all this on the show. He wrote for it. D&D cut it out, to give their fave Sansa something more to do than vegetate in the Vale without a plot since GRRM has only written 3 chapters for her over 18 years. They also like the North plot and decided to put Sansa in there. People extrapolating from there that the North is all about Sansa and her becoming Queen in the North etc. are going to be in for a rude shock next season. Whatever D&D wrote the last couple of seasons, they are still heading to the same ending for the show that GRRM intended.
